comment: The same prompt the entire semester. Didn't grade the main essays until the end of the semester only to be like "Oh this wasn't a prompt you could've selected" WHICH IT WAS. And that essay happened to be the one that builds upon all the other essays that came after so THANK YOU FOR THE VERY EARLY WARNING ????

DO NOT CHOOSE THIS PROFESSOR THIS IS A WARNING!!!!!!! With her rubrics and grading, she is incredibly vague, but at the same time incredibly specific, and it's super hard to know if you met the criteria or not. She is pretty much inaccessible through ANY forms of email (d2l email and ksu outlook) and she only uses remind. CHOOSE ANYONE BUT HER PLS

The content in the course is very repetitive. The class is mindless and has no variety. you just talk about 1 topic for an entire semester. I should not get 2 F's just because I turned in an assignment "wrong". You either choose all assignments to be text box submissions or docx. Do not make it complicated. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS! IM TO SAVING YOU.

Absolutely awful. We had to write about the same tired prompts and concepts all semester. Half the grades still aren't posted from the beginning of the class. And seriously—who uses Remind to communicate? Her grading was beyond strict, and the rubrics? Total trash. No clear guidelines, just vibes. I wouldn't wish this class on my worst enemy.

THIS IS NOT A RATING, THIS IS A PUBLIC SAFETY WARNING. PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF, LIKE THERE IS NO WAY THIS PROFESSOR IS A REAL HUMAN BEING. LIKE WHAT????? RUN, DONT WALK. GO AHEAD AND FILE A RESTRAINING ORDER WHILE YOU'RE AT IT.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Don't walk RUN!! She is terrible get ready to write over the same concept all semester and have your work tore to shreds. She takes a whole semester to give grades back with vague feedback on how to improve. Her rubrics/instructions are so confusing! Also you are REQUIRED to meet with writing center and sources have to be from KSU library for paper

A complete disaster of a course and her grading is absolutely ridiculous. This whole semester has been about the exact same topic and she gives zero detail on assignments. Also WHY ARE MY ASSIGNMENTS FROM 2 MONTHS AGO STILL NOT GRADED?! And she counts off 20 points for an incorrect indention. This is english, not nuclear physics. take ANYONE else
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: If you enjoy working hard on a paper only to have it torn apart over the tiniest, most ridiculous details, this is the professor for you. She nitpicks everything, she gave mostly everyone an F on a video assignment since it was submitted as a link. Expect to lose points over the most absurd things. If you want an easy A then avoid her at all costs.

Teacher actively tries to push an agenda towards students and has absolutely zero diversity when it comes to reading subject matter. Be ready to only hear about women's suffrage and nothing else. Teacher is also a rough grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment:
She doesn't give clear instructions on her rubrics. She is an incredibly harsh grader. Terrible at communication. She always finds something wrong with every essay and takes off SO many points! The only reason I passed is because I worked myself half-to-death throughout the class, with no help/feedback from her.

I do not recommend!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: We would get graded harshly on essays but grades were not given back until nearly the end if the semester, limiting my chance to take in feedback and improve since I did not know i performed poorly yet. The obligation of going to the librarian and writing center so often became incompatible with my schedule as well
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Refused to give me an extension on the final paper when I literally had to attend a model UN 3-day conference FOR KSU, does not give clear feedback on essays, and is very harsh with grading! The writing department, which she makes us consult, said my essay was good and they didn't really have any feedback and she gave me a D on the essay still!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Honestly a decent professor in my opinion, but I understand where some of these reviews are coming from. She is a tough grader, and can be hard to reach since she uses Remind to communicate. I honestly thought she was pretty helpful in certain circumstances, and she would do zoom meetings with us outside of class regarding any questions. (Hybrid)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She's a harsh grader and not understanding in the slightest when it comes to questions with assignments and grades. Every class is the same with a short reading and a boring group presentation. If you miss a class and don't have a doctors note or proof of a good excuse she will give you a 0 for the in-class assignment that day.
DO NOT TAKE HER, Grades harsh, lots of work, not understanding, tons of writing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I'm still in the process of taking her class but I would not recommend her class. Her grading is over the top and you have no room for errors AT ALL or it will affect your grade, even for the slightest thing like one grammar error. Instructions are often unclear and she isn't the most helpful. Find another professor if you can.

She refused to use email to commute and rarely responded on time from remind app. I had hybrid and the worst part of my week was coming to this useless class. Not good at explaining instructions, lots of group work/ presentations and overall is pretty rude. Coming from someone who took AP lit classes before just choose someone else..

Dropped me a letter grade because of a grammatical error on an essay, then when I asked for a meeting to talk about it, there wasn't even an error! Her criteria was never clear, and she graded far too harshly. I was a straight A student in all my english classes in high school.

I have not yet finished this course and I would recommend you find anyone but her. Assignments are released online weekly, often giving 5-6 days of notice before a rather large paper is due. Her grading turnaround time says 2 weeks yet I have not received a single grade since August. When emailing she is entirely unhelpful as well.

Took her DE class at Gwinnett Tech and she's a terrible grader. I lost points for being a few lines short of a 4-page minimum, and I also remember she took off a large chunk for a discussion where I replied to only one peer instead of two because only one person posted before it was due. There's more, but that is all I can fit. - Straight-A student

Definitely worst professor I have had so far! Purifoy is an extremely tough grader and not lax at all on due dates. The worst part was the curriculum, the whole semester we focused on one topic to write multiple essays and assignments on. It was extremely repetitive and did not allow for any room to be creative. Would not recommend to anyone.

The worst professor I have ever had, do not take her. I was in the hospital for 2 days and was not able to come to class when we were doing a presentation, I asked her if I could do it when I came back or even send a video of me doing it in the hospital, and she said no and gave me a 0 when it was a legitimate excuse.

Professor Purifoy is a nice person overall, but when it comes to teaching she is not the professor you want. She takes weeks to months to grade although she claims it will only take her 2 weeks. Assignments from early weeks were graded with criteria we learned weeks later dramatically taking off 15+ points. Gives terrible feedback.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Extremely unpleasant experience throughout semester. Class constantly cancelled for "sickness" but would return perfectly fine with full makeover. Final essay made to be written in a style never once used prior to the final. Unaware of actual standing in class because week 3 assignments were being graded with week 9 criteria in week 14. Just don't.

I do not reccomend this Professor. She isn't the best at explaining or relying upon. we were not in class more than we were in  class because she cancelled and that really affected my grades. Her assignments also seemed to be very specific and obscure. I do not recommend her class because it is not easy to pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The single worst teacher I have ever had. She has so many assignments to the point that she makes you do work instead of teaching. My friends know her by first name because of the breakdowns she caused. Even if taking her class makes the difference between you graduating on time, I'd recommend paying the money to wait. It's better than Purifoy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She is cool as a person, but not the ideal professor you want. It takes a lot to please her. She also didn't tell us the first few quizzes were open notes. She expected us to know although it was a lockdown browser with cam on. Smh.

Purifoy was a true nightmare. I had an A+ until the final, which was changed last minute to essay corrections (also due one day earlier). My lowest essay was still an A+, so I made an edit and turned it in to only end up with a 0, because I turned it in 1 day late, which ended up dropping my grade to a 79, so I missed out on Zell Miller. Lost ~$12k

Students expected to know the first few quizzes were open book without being informed, then after being informed of this it was changed to closed book. Little to zero actual essay feedback given. Random assignment given to review her friends' article where our "praise" of it was video recorded and applause was required. Save yourself the trouble.

I don't understand where Professor Purifoy's bad ratings are coming from. She was readily available outside of class time and was very understanding. She can be a tough grader but her rubrics are clear to the requirement. She is extremely nice, caring, and makes in class lectures hilarious! I would absolutely recommend Professor Purifoy.

I enjoy her as a professor but she's a tough grader and doesn't give much feedback. Assignments are given weekly and she takes weeks and weeks to grade assignments. If you make a small mistake you'll get tons of points off, enough to go from an A to a C on one thing. Heavy on class participation. Daily in class assignments so show up.
gives no feedback on papers. I didn't learn much;/
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I've gotten an A in legitimately every english class i've ever taken. I know how to write papers. This professor grades so roughly and gives a crumb of feedback, not even. Instructions for assignments are always vague. Makes homework due on a Friday, which is already frustrating enough. I genuinely would not recommend this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I'm just going to tell you now if you have the choice take ANY other professor possible. Avoid her at all costs. No lenience for anything, so many papers not enough time. We all aren't as adept in writing as you are.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Tough Grader

Expect to write a LOT of papers and discussions. She as a person seems nice but isn't clear on what she actually wants you to do. A textbook is required. VERY VERY tough grader. Doesn't give feedback on how to improve what you did, only tells you what was wrong. New assignments/papers every week. If you can TAKE SOMEONE ELSE.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I wish I would've gone to this site prior to registering with her.  She is not a good instructor at all.  During the first half of the semester, I had 5 pending assignments to be graded (5-6 weeks not graded). You could write 5 pages of great writing but if you have 1 extra space you will get a B. Her posts have typos.  Not helpful when you email.

Assignment guidelines are unclear, and if you don't follow implied rules then many points will be deducted. Assignments are due Friday, often in the same week and days after being explained. Turning in late (even by minutes) is a full letter grade penalty for each day. Nearly all assignments either contain a video component or are a group project.

I'm taking ENGL 1102 at Gwinnett Tech and Professor Purifoy is a really nice person, even though she's also a really tough grader.
I do love the types of assignments she gives out as well as the format; we read stories, watch a movie, engage in discussion boards, etc.

This is honestly the worst professor at KSU. She is a beyond tough grader, the assignments are extremely confusing, and she explains everything poorly. Do not take this class. You will hate every second of your life.
Horrible teacher she does not give feedback on your writing and when ask how can you improve your writing she is not clear on it. Gives you 5 days to do an essay. Also grades late never on time

This professor is the most unclear professor I have ever come across. She gives very little instructions and answers questions vaguely. She is also an extremely tough grade. For example you have an introduction assignment on yourself and it wasn’t uncommon for students to get 90’s on a introduction of themselves.

Professor Purifoy is a very tough grader. Expect to only receive B's and lower on everything. She is unbelievably unclear about everything which makes it difficult to get the work done. The rubrics and information are vague and she is terrible at explaining how to do them. If you do not like dystopian literature then this is not the class for you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She was a very tough grader and made it worse by not being specific on what the criteria was. Was not very helpful when asking questions and wasnt available outside of class. I would not take her if i had another choice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Even though the class is easy, she was very unclear on what exactly she wanted us to do for assignments. Textbook reading is also mandatory, she will know if you haven't read it. Although she's enjoyable during lectures, there really is no instruction and I personally can't say there's anything I've taken away from the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: She was a great teacher a good amount of home work but it was very easy. She gives 3 essays which are not very long &  easy but does require writing center. Attendance is mandatory for her! Shes a great teacher very funny & sympathetic to any issues u have. I would  take her again and I do recommend! As long as you do the work your good!

She gives 3 papers proposals are due before each one. Textbook Becoming Rhetorica is required if you don't read she gives a quiz. At least 2 writing assignments per week and 1 in-class assignment per week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She assumed everyone had read Divergent & gave us one week to write an essay on it. Didn't list it in the syllabus or mention it beforehand. Very harsh grader with abysmal feedback. She clearly thinks she is superior to her students & dodges the question if you ask her for help or to explain her decision. Worst professor I've ever had by a mile

This class was just kind of a joke, we only read 1 book the whole semester (Fahrenheit 451). There were weekly writing responses and some bigger writing assignments as well, but it had the difficulty level of somewhere below a ninth-grade English class. If you're looking for an easy A, she's fine; if you want to grow as a writer, take someone else.
She grades really rough. Wants to ruin your grade. Doesn't help when you need help. She sucks as a professor.

Class is fun but tough. Class time is enjoyable, lots of group projects, be prepared to do some minor public speaking. Pretty extensive homework every week, and the essays and final project are not easy. But Purifoy's lectures are enjoyable and I felt like I could go to her for help if needed. Her essay feedback could have been more detailed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Horrible grader, incredibly unhelpful, gives feedback which not only doesnt make sense, but offers nothing constructive to benefit you as a student at all. Whats worse is that when you try to email her to get an explanation of her feedback, she just explains that she didnt make any mistakes and that its your fault if you dont understand. AVOID
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She gave 5 essays and discussion posts that are due every Friday at 5. You are also graded on participating in class. Professor purifoy is very nice and understanding. You can get an A if you put in the work

This professor was extremely good in many ways such as making class interesting and having some pretty nice ways to engage with other students my only complaint with her is that her essay grading is extremely unclear at times also beware because she will call on anyone in the class so be prepared for sure
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Loads of group work, and presenting. Decently tough grader, but not that difficult of a class.
Prof. Purifoy is so sweet, but she is a really tough grader. I'm not a great writter so it was difficult, but she's really fun in class. Four major papers and weekly homework. Pretty good stuff.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: She's very understanding with issues involving students. Gives great feedback on papers. Cares about her students and their education. You must participate and talk, the class is usually small and the topics are interesting.
She was very unclear in what exactly she wanted us to do. She made us read out of the textbook everyday in class, which wasted a lot of time. Her grading was tough on homework assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Be ready to participate in this class. You'll have to speak and you will get called on, so go ahead and volunteer for the questions you want to answer. For the essays, it is kind of unclear what she wants from you. Utilize the writing center and ask her questions for clarity. DO THE HOMEWORK it does affect your grade. She grades tough, be prepared.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Attendance is a part of your grade, but is a waste of time. The homework is easy and a breeze. There are 3 essays and she grades hard with mediocre feedback. In class she makes the essays seem elementary though. However, she can be helpful through email. The class itself was easy but the essays take a majority of your grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Make sure to always check her syllabus or you will miss assignments. Pretty easy and fun class.
